translation.en: [Richards] Life's a funny thing, you know.
translation.ja: 人生とは不思議なものだ

translation.en: But I've always thought 30 was about it.
translation.ja: 30年で十分だと思ってた

translation.en: Beyond that would be horrible to be alive.
translation.ja: それ以上 粘っても惨めだと

translation.en: Until I got to be 31.
translation.ja: でも31歳になった時

translation.en: Then, "Why, I ain't so shabby," you know. [laughs] "I'll hang in a while."
translation.ja: “もう少し生きるのも悪くない”と思ったんだ

translation.en: As you go along, you realize that this whole concept of growing up is...
translation.ja: 成長という概念に対する意識も変わった

translation.en: You're not grown up until the day they put you six feet under.
translation.ja: 人は墓に入るまで成長し続けるのさ

translation.en: You're never grown up.
translation.ja: ゴールはないんだ

translation.en: You don't get bluer than that.
translation.ja: これぞブルースだ

translation.en: Man, that's bad stuff.
translation.ja: やっぱり染みるね

translation.en: [Richards] The power of the blues was a mind blower.
translation.ja: ブルースの迫力には圧倒された

translation.en: Anybody who could make a sound like that is all right with me. [chuckles] You know what I mean?
translation.ja: こんな音を出せる奴となら仲良くなりたい

translation.en: For me, music is like the center of everything.
translation.ja: 俺にとって音楽はすべての中心なんだ

translation.en: It's something that binds people together through centuries, through millennium.
translation.ja: 今まで何百年も何千年も人と人をつないできたのさ

translation.en: It's undefinable.
translation.ja: 定義ができない

translation.en: And nobody's ever going to have the answer to it, but it's great fun exploring.
translation.ja: 一生 無理だろうけど考えるのは楽しいよね

translation.en: -Anthony, how are you? -How are you?
translation.ja: アンソニー 久しぶり

translation.en: Once more into the breach.
translation.ja: 今回もよろしく

translation.en: [Richards] How you been, Anthony?
translation.ja: 調子はどう？

translation.en: -I'm very well, thank you. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 元気ですありがとうジャーナリストアンソニー･デ･カーティス ジャーナリストアンソニー･デ･カーティス

translation.en: So, Keith, I've been enjoying your new music.
translation.ja: 新譜もいい仕上がりですね

translation.en: Why don't you tell me a little bit about getting it going?
translation.ja: きっかけから話してもらえますか？

translation.en: You know, what made you decide to jump back in?
translation.ja: なぜまたソロアルバムを？

translation.en: I've been thinking about that.
translation.ja: 俺もそれについて考えてたんだ

translation.en: You know, I think it coincided with the fact
translation.ja: 俺もそれについて考えてたんだ 本を書いたことが関係してると思う

translation.en: that I was doing the book, you know...
translation.ja: 本を書いたことが関係してると思う 聖書に次いで大事な俺の自叙伝さ

translation.en: -Second only to the Bible. -[both chuckle]
translation.ja: 聖書に次いで大事な俺の自叙伝さ

translation.en: And The Stones had one of their... where they suddenly go into hibernation for about five years.
translation.ja: ザ･ローリング･ストーンズも５年ほど休みに入ったしね

translation.en: 'Cause we... The Stones had been working a lot until about 2007.
translation.ja: 2007年頃まではずっと精力的に活動してたんだ

translation.en: And I was kind of itching to get back in the studio.
translation.ja: そろそろスタジオに戻りたかったのさ

translation.en: I love recording, you see.
translation.ja: レコーディングが大好きなんだ

translation.en: Any studio, I feel totally at home there.
translation.ja: スタジオの中はとにかく落ち着く

translation.en: Everywhere else, you know, is, you know... there's the bags.
translation.ja: 他の場所だとそうはいかない

translation.en: [Steve Jordan] Should we get another mic in there? -Or should we just move the ribbon closer? -[Richards] No, listen...
translation.ja: もう１本 マイクを入れる？それとも近づける？

translation.en: Play a couple things.
translation.ja: 弾いてみて

translation.en: That's better, right?
translation.ja: マシだよね？

translation.en: [Richards] And the next thing I know, Steve Jordan came to me, and he said,
translation.ja: スティーヴ･ジョーダンにこう言われたんだ

translation.en: "How about just the two of us go in the studio,
translation.ja: “２人だけでスタジオに入ってみないか？”

translation.en: you know, just you and me, and we'll cut a couple of tracks?
translation.ja: “２人だけでスタジオに入ってみないか？” “まずは数曲作ってみればいい”と

translation.en: Just, you know, see what happens."
translation.ja: “まずは数曲作ってみればいい”と

translation.en: [Jordan] He said something and it was kind of shocking. And I asked him never to say that again.
translation.ja: ある時 キースが驚くことを突然 言い出したんだ

translation.en: He said, "Well, you know, I've done all of this... and now the book and everything." He hadn't been playing.
translation.ja: 〝音楽を存分にやり自叙伝も書いたから 〞

translation.en: And he was like, "You know, maybe I should, like, retire," kinda thing.
translation.ja: プロデューサースティーヴ･ジョーダン〝音楽を存分にやり自叙伝も書いたから 〞 プロデューサースティーヴ･ジョーダン プロデューサースティーヴ･ジョーダン〝そろそろ引退してもいいかな 〞と 〝そろそろ引退してもいいかな 〞と

translation.en: -Yeah. -At which I completely freaked out. [laughing] I said, "What are you talking about?"
translation.ja: パニックに陥ったよ“正気か？”ってね

translation.en: I was talking in my sleep.
translation.ja: きっと寝言だ

translation.en: I said, "What are you talking about?"
translation.ja: “頼むから言うな”と

translation.en: [man 1] Can you get it? Yeah. [man 2] Yep.
translation.ja: 音はどう？

translation.en: [man 1] Yeah, it's a little boomy. [man 2] Uh-huh.
translation.ja: 響いてるね

translation.en: [Tom Waits] Musically, what I noticed about Keith, is he's really big on detail.
translation.ja: キースは音楽を作る時細部にまでこだわるんだ

translation.en: And you have to be if you're...
translation.ja: キースのような“考古学者タイプ”なら トム･ウェイツ キースのような“考古学者タイプ”なら

translation.en: an archeologist and you're, you know...
translation.ja: トム･ウェイツ それは当然のことだ それは当然のことだ

translation.en: You insist on locality data, you know.
translation.ja: 現場の情報が大切だからね

translation.en: Not only where something came from, but what are the principles and the properties of it.
translation.ja: その物事の出どころや本質と特性にまでこだわる

translation.en: And he...
translation.ja: 彼はロンドンのタクシー運転手のように

translation.en: He's like a... like a London cabbie who has The Knowledge.
translation.ja: 彼はロンドンのタクシー運転手のように 多くの知識を持ってるんだ

translation.en: -[man] Yeah, yeah. -Only he has that in music, you know.
translation.ja: もちろん音楽についてね

translation.en: [Richards] I realized, as I was doing this stuff,
translation.ja: 俺がアメリカのフォークに

translation.en: how much steeped I am in American folk music,
translation.ja: 俺がアメリカのフォークに いかに夢中だったか思い出した

translation.en: in jazz and blues.
translation.ja: ジャズやブルースもね

translation.en: That's the stuff that America has given the rest of the world.
translation.ja: アメリカが世界に広めた文化だ

translation.en: You know, far bigger than H-bombs. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 水素爆弾よりも重要さ

translation.en: [Richards] Crosseyed Heart, I'm doing a lot of the tipping of the hat to people.
translation.ja: 「クロスアイド･ハート」はいろんな人に曲を捧げてる

translation.en: And this was to Robert Johnson.
translation.ja: １曲目はロバート･ジョンソンに

translation.en: [Richards] I grew up listening basically to American music, even though I was in England.
translation.ja: 俺はイギリスでアメリカの音楽を聴いて育った

translation.en: And through that, I guess I realized that an awful lot of American music, blues included,
translation.ja: そこで気づいたのはブルースなどの多くの楽曲は

translation.en: relied a lot upon old Celtic melodies,
translation.ja: ケルト音楽のメロディーに似てるということだ

translation.en: Irish, Scottish, English, Welsh, that became part of this country, you know.
translation.ja: アイルランドやウェールズスコットランドなどの音楽さ

translation.en: So to me, it was translatable easily.
translation.ja: だからより親しみやすかった

translation.en: When I first heard Robert Johnson and Lead Belly,
translation.ja: ロバート･ジョンソンを初めて聴いた時

translation.en: and I'm hearing an echo...
translation.ja: ロバート･ジョンソンを初めて聴いた時 ガーンと響いたよ

translation.en: You know, I'm hearing... In my bones, I'm hearing
translation.ja: どういうわけか骨にまで響いてきた

translation.en: an echo that I shouldn't be hearing because it's not within earshot.
translation.ja: 生歌を聴いてるわけではないのにね

translation.en: Which is one of the reasons I wanted to start this thing off with the blues, you know.
translation.ja: だからアルバムの１曲目をブルースにしたんだ

translation.en: I mean, I ain't a pop star no more, you know.
translation.ja: だからアルバムの１曲目をブルースにしたんだ 俺はポップスターじゃない

translation.en: I don't wanna be. [laughs]
translation.ja: もう結構だ

translation.en: See, I swore... You know, I thought it was in E, for Christ's sake.
translation.ja: 俺はＥだと思い込んでた

translation.en: I mean, I swore... I would have gone to the grave saying that I played this in E, man, until today.
translation.ja: このまま死ぬまでＥで演奏するところだった

translation.en: [Richards] My mum was a beautiful music freak with incredible taste.
translation.ja: 母は音楽マニアで趣味もすばらしかった

translation.en: We only had, like, two radio stations in the whole country, you know.
translation.ja: 当時はラジオ局が２つほどしかなくて

translation.en: And she was a wizard of the dial.
translation.ja: その間を行き来してた

translation.en: If there was anything worth listening to, she would find it.
translation.ja: 聴きたい曲を必ず見つけてくるのさ

translation.en: Sarah Vaughan and Ella Fitzgerald were her two top thrushes.
translation.ja: サラ･ヴォーンとエラ･フィッツジェラルドが 母のお気に入りだった

translation.en: I liked Billie Holiday. Billie had more edge on it for me.
translation.ja: 俺はビリー･ホリデイ よりエッジが効いてたがそういう曲で育ったんだ

translation.en: But still, that's what I grew up with. You know what I mean?
translation.ja: よりエッジが効いてたがそういう曲で育ったんだ

translation.en: Louis Armstrong...
translation.ja: ルイ･アームストロングや

translation.en: Billy Eckstine...
translation.ja: ビリー･エクスタイン

translation.en: and a little dash of Mozart here and there.
translation.ja: モーツァルトを合間に聴いたりね

translation.en: And then all the usual rubbish. Whatever they played on radio.
translation.ja: ラジオで流れてるカスみたいな曲も耳にしてた

translation.en: You know, the stuff you couldn't avoid, you know.
translation.ja: 避けられないからね

translation.en: ♪ I'm a pink toothbrush You're a blue toothbrush ♪
translation.ja: “私はピンクの歯ブラシ君はブルーの歯ブラシ”

translation.en: [Richards] All of that crap, you know? I mean, the '50s,
translation.ja: 1950年代の素晴らしき“カス”たちだ

translation.en: which is, all right, great rubbish, in retrospect.
translation.ja: 1950年代の素晴らしき“カス”たちだ 今にして思い返すとね

translation.en: Growing up in England, just after the war, there was rubble everywhere.
translation.ja: 大戦直後のイギリスはがれきだらけだった

translation.en: I was not aware that there was any other world apart from bombed out ruins.
translation.ja: それ以外の世界があるのを知らなかった

translation.en: And then, suddenly, Elvis. He hit like a bombshell.
translation.ja: そこに登場したのがエルヴィス･プレスリー

translation.en: "Baby Let's Play House" was around then, and it really cooked me.
translation.ja: “ベイビー･レッツ･プレイ･ハウス”にやられたね

translation.en: The world went from black-and-white to Technicolor.
translation.ja: モノクロの世界に色がついた

translation.en: [Richards] America looked very attractive.
translation.ja: アメリカは魅力的に見えた

translation.en: All the movies.
translation.ja: 映画の世界もね

translation.en: We got what you guys saw, like, a year before.
translation.ja: 最新情報の先取りに必死さ

translation.en: Especially if you're into music. That was basically our lifeline in those days,
translation.ja: 音楽好きにとってそれは生きがいでもあった

translation.en: that sense of, there's something happening, and you just wanna be part of it, you know,
translation.ja: 何かが始まりそうなあの興奮を味わいたくて

translation.en: and you jumped in with both feet. At least, I did.
translation.ja: 勢いよく中に飛び込んだんだ

translation.en: [Richards] Jim Hall.
translation.ja: ジム･ホール

translation.en: [Jordan] We love Jim Hall.
translation.ja: みんな 好きだよね

translation.en: -Jim, motherfucker. -[laughs]
translation.ja: ジムは最高だぜ

translation.en: [Richards] My grandfather, Gus, he kinda teased me, man,
translation.ja: 祖父のガスが⸺ 時間をかけて俺をギタリストに育ててくれた

translation.en: over years, into becoming a guitarist.
translation.ja: 時間をかけて俺をギタリストに育ててくれた

translation.en: He was one of those guys that always thought
translation.ja: 祖父は誰でもチャンスを与えたら

translation.en: everybody was a musician if they got the chance to be and...
translation.ja: 祖父は誰でもチャンスを与えたら 音楽家になれると信じてた

translation.en: So I think he just left the instruments lying about just to see if it caught the eye.
translation.ja: まずは楽器を置いて目に留まるか見るんだ

translation.en: And then he probably watched me for a couple of years, you know,
translation.ja: そうやって俺は数年間 観察され続けてた

translation.en: talking to him and looking at the guitar and...
translation.ja: そうやって俺は数年間 観察され続けてた ギターを気にする姿をね

translation.en: 'Cause I remember him saying, "It's a pretty one, isn't it? It's nice, that.
translation.ja: “いいギターだろ”と言われたのを覚えてる

translation.en: Yeah, when you can reach it... I'll let you play it," you know.
translation.ja: “手が届いたら触らせてやるよ”って

translation.en: Once he did give me the guitar,
translation.ja: やっと持たせてくれて

translation.en: he said the best exercise is the Spanish malaguena,
translation.ja: “マラゲーニャ”を練習するように言われた

translation.en: because it's got a lot of moves in it that make it great for the fingers.
translation.ja: 指の動きが多様で鍛えられるからだ

translation.en: You're expanding yourself without even knowing.
translation.ja: おかげで知らぬ間に可能性を広げることができてた

translation.en: And he was quite right, because, you know, from learning that...
translation.ja: おかげで知らぬ間に可能性を広げることができてた “その曲をマスターしないと”

translation.en: 'Cause I had to learn that
translation.ja: “その曲をマスターしないと”

translation.en: in order to get the guitar, you know. I mean...
translation.ja: “ギターはあげない”と言われた

translation.en: That meant I could walk into the house, pick up the guitar and play with it.
translation.ja: まだ勝手には手に取れなかった

translation.en: Until then, it would have to be at invitation only.
translation.ja: 祖父の許可が必要だった

translation.en: -[man] The story with the guitar... -Oh, it's a...
translation.ja: ギターの話をして 50年代後半のギブソンＥＳ-３５５だ

translation.en: It's a late '50s Gibson ES-355.
translation.ja: ギター技術者ピエール･ド･ボーポール50年代後半のギブソンＥＳ-３５５だ

translation.en: So, kind of a hot rod.
translation.ja: 貴重な１本さ

translation.en: He's always been known for playing a black Gibson.
translation.ja: キースは黒いギブソンで有名だ

translation.en: For me, it looks like Keith.
translation.ja: キースっぽいよね

translation.en: And as I just showed you, when I opened the case,
translation.ja: ケースを開けた瞬間

translation.en: he said, "I'll have it." He didn't... Nope. Just... He knew right away.
translation.ja: “これをもらう”って即答したんだ

translation.en: I've been working with Keith now since the '80s. I have full access to his guitar lockers and can do what I want.
translation.ja: 80年代から彼の下で働きギターの管理を担ってる

translation.en: I do often get to see guitars and bring them to him.
translation.ja: ギターを調達して持っていく

translation.en: This is what Robert Johnson would have played, the model and year.
translation.ja: ロバート･ジョンソンが弾いてたモデルだ

translation.en: This is a 1928 L-1 Gibson, you know.
translation.ja: これは1928年製のギブソンのＬ-１だ

translation.en: And the scale length and the flat neck and the width of the nut...
translation.ja: スケールやナット幅ネックなどが特徴的だ

translation.en: It was a style of playing. So you can do the finger style blues on this.
translation.ja: フィンガー･スタイルのブルースも弾ける

translation.en: It almost takes you there. It makes you play that way.
translation.ja: ギターが自然と導いてくれるんだ

translation.en: The notes last the right amount of time.
translation.ja: ギターが自然と導いてくれるんだ 音の長さや高音と低音のバランス

translation.en: The balance between the high strings
translation.ja: 音の長さや高音と低音のバランス

translation.en: and what's going on in the low-end, the snap...
translation.ja: 手首のスナップもね

translation.en: In the locker, unfinished project.
translation.ja: ある時 ロッカーに

translation.en: National Guitar, right here, in my inventory book of Keith's guitars.
translation.ja: ナショナル･ギターが眠ってたんだ

translation.en: It says here, "To be rebuilt and then maybe used."
translation.ja: メモ欄には… “調整すれば使用可”

translation.en: And I wrote a note, "Kinda reminds me of Jimmy Reed."
translation.ja: “ジミー･リードを彷彿とさせる”と

translation.en: Dig it out, put some strings on it.
translation.ja: 弦を張ったら

translation.en: And sometimes I pick up an instrument and the sound will take you to a different place. It's like a flavor.
translation.ja: その音色は 異世界に誘われるように魅力的だった

translation.en: Steve and Keith walk in. They think we're doing something else.
translation.ja: その時 スティーヴとキースが入ってきた

translation.en: We open the case. Keith looks at it, "Oh, great. Hmm."
translation.ja: その時 スティーヴとキースが入ってきた 彼はギターを見て一目で気に入ってた

translation.en: "Check this out, Keith.
translation.ja: 彼はギターを見て一目で気に入ってた

translation.en: This has been yours since before I worked for you. It's never had strings on it. I found it in the locker, I put strings on it."
translation.ja: 眠ってたギターに弦を張っただけと言うと⸺

translation.en: Next thing you know, he's out there trying it. Steve's like, "Okay, if he's in, I'm in."
translation.ja: キースとスティーヴはすぐスタジオに入っていった

translation.en: They start playing, but the control room is set for, you know... for a mix or something.
translation.ja: でもコントロールルームではミキシング中で

translation.en: There's no mic set. People aren't ready for this.
translation.ja: 準備もできてなかった

translation.en: "Blues in the Morning," that feeling...
translation.ja: “ブルース･イン･ザ･モーニング”は

translation.en: That was just him picking up the guitar.
translation.ja: そうやって突然レコーディングされたんだ

translation.en: There was no second takes, no other tries. It was just where we were going.
translation.ja: そうやって突然レコーディングされたんだ 一発でね

translation.en: [Richards] To us, in England, people like Mick and myself and many others...
translation.ja: 俺やミックが新しい音楽に飢えてる時に

translation.en: Chuck arrived... At the time, we were starving for music.
translation.ja: チャック･ベリーがタイミングよく現れたんだ

translation.en: The way that man hit us... I'm still recovering.
translation.ja: あの時の衝撃からまだ立ち直れてない

translation.en: Incredible lyrics, an incredible devil-may-care attitude.
translation.ja: 歌詞も向こう見ずな態度もカッコよかった

translation.en: He's influenced just about every guitar player,
translation.ja: ギタリストなら皆影響を受けたはずだ

translation.en: even if they don't know it. You know, I mean...
translation.ja: ギタリストなら皆影響を受けたはずだ だが 体裁を気にして

translation.en: not a lot of guys wanna play like Chuck because it's like taking on the devil.
translation.ja: 彼のように弾くのをためらう奴もいた

translation.en: I'll take it on, you know. [laughs]
translation.ja: 俺には関係ない

translation.en: Yeah, this is the beginning of the Rolling Stones, you know.
translation.ja: ザ･ローリング･ストーンズ結成は

translation.en: Yeah, and I'm holding a full deck here, pals.
translation.ja: マディ･ウォーターズのアルバムがきっかけなんだ

translation.en: That was the one Mick had on the train, you know.
translation.ja: ミックが電車の中で持ってたのさ

translation.en: I got on my morning train to go to art school.
translation.ja: 美術学校に行くために電車に乗ったら

translation.en: I happened to hit the carriage that Mick had just gotten into,
translation.ja: 同じ車両でミックに出くわした

translation.en: and I hadn't seen him in years.
translation.ja: 数年ぶりだった

translation.en: And then I noticed, tucked under his arm, like this, was...
translation.ja: 彼がこうして脇の下に抱えてたアルバムが…

translation.en: "Oh, yeah. Get out of here. Chuck Berry... What you got there, man?"
translation.ja: 奴はチャック･ベリーも持ってたんだ

translation.en: And then I said, "Come here!"
translation.ja: “おい 本気かよ”ってうれしくなったね

translation.en: You know, I thought I was the only other guy in...
translation.ja: イギリスの南東部で⸺

translation.en: you know, in the southeast of England that even knew anything about this stuff, you know, and...
translation.ja: 彼らを知ってるのは俺くらいだと思ってたのにさ

translation.en: So, I mean, by the time we got off the train, you know,
translation.ja: 電車を降りる頃には⸺

translation.en: we've made a deal, you know. I'm gonna... [chuckles]
translation.ja: 互いに約束を交わしてたんだ

translation.en: And that's how The Stones hooked, because of these very two records. And that's it.
translation.ja: この２枚の存在のおかげでバンドは誕生したんだ

translation.en: Muddy, I had only heard, you know, very few tracks of at the time.
translation.ja: 当時 マディの曲は数曲しか知らなくて

translation.en: So this was a mind blower to me, you know.
translation.ja: 初めて聴いた時はぶっ飛んだよ

translation.en: [Richards] When I first heard The Best of Muddy Waters,
translation.ja: 「ベスト･オブ･マディ･ウォーターズ」ほど

translation.en: it was the most powerful music I'd ever heard.
translation.ja: パワフルなアルバムはなかった

translation.en: The most expressive. And I had listened to Mozart and, you know, I had listened to Beethoven.
translation.ja: モーツァルトやベートーベンに引けを取らないくらい

translation.en: This is on a par with the best music in the world.
translation.ja: 表現力豊かな名曲がそろってたんだ

translation.en: The Stones, in their early days,
translation.ja: マディの曲を聴いてもらいたくて

translation.en: all we wanted to do was to turn other people on to this.
translation.ja: 俺たちはバンドを始めたようなものだ

translation.en: [Richards] We knew we're never gonna be able to play it like Muddy. So let's just, like, juke it up.
translation.ja: マディのように演奏するには100年早かったから

translation.en: We sped it up, we did it real fast. And everybody got into it.
translation.ja: スピードを上げてみたらうまくいったのさ

translation.en: [Richards] We've never wanted to make pop music.
translation.ja: ポップに興味はなかった

translation.en: Our puritanical mission was to turn other people on to the blues.
translation.ja: 俺たちの任務はブルースを普及させることだった

translation.en: At the same time, we realized that we turned America back on to its own music,
translation.ja: アメリカ人が自らのルーツを見直すことになったのは

translation.en: which was, like, far beyond the agenda.
translation.ja: 俺たちにも計算外だったけどね

translation.en: The Rolling Stones. Aren't they great?
translation.ja: ザ･ローリング･ストーンズでした

translation.en: Unbelievable.
translation.ja: すごいですね

translation.en: -[Richards] Hey, guys. -What's up, boss? How are you guys? How're we doing? -Alright? -Thank you, Keith.
translation.ja: やあ みんな調子はどうだ

translation.en: Awesome. -How you doing? -Great show the other... -I'm doing fabulous. -Yes, sir. Great show.
translation.ja: ありがとう先日のライブは最高だったよ

translation.en: -Alright. Yeah, yeah. -Great book, brother.
translation.ja: 本もすばらしい

translation.en: Cool, brother.
translation.ja: うれしいね

translation.en: How you doing, Keith?
translation.ja: 元気かい？

translation.en: -We're doing alright, man. -Good.
translation.ja: 順調だよ

translation.en: -Right on. Thank you. -We're all alright, you know.
translation.ja: やったね　ありがとう

translation.en: [Richards] On the road, I feel at home.
translation.ja: ツアーが好きなんだ

translation.en: Being backstage or being onstage, you know, it's... familiar.
translation.ja: ステージ上もステージ裏も俺の居場所だと感じる

translation.en: [man] Thank you. [Richards] There you go, pal. -Okay. -[woman] Can I get a high five?
translation.ja: どうぞ　よろしくね

translation.en: Hi, baby. [laughs]
translation.ja: やあ ベイビー

translation.en: I left home at 17 in a cloud of disgrace,
translation.ja: 俺は17歳の時に家を飛び出したんだ

translation.en: without getting, you know, my dad's okay.
translation.ja: 親父の許可を得ずにね

translation.en: And so the road became a second home to me, you know.
translation.ja: だから転々とすることには慣れてる

translation.en: [man 1] You brought the sun out. [man 2] Ronnie, how are you?
translation.ja: 晴れたぞ

translation.en: [Richards] And I'm looking forward still to some great gigs. I mean, I really enjoyed playing in the heartland.
translation.ja: アメリカでツアーを行うのをすごく楽しみにしてるよ

translation.en: They're the places we used to drive around in the station wagon 50 years ago.
translation.ja: 50年前に回った時はステーションワゴンだった

translation.en: America is the biggest market in the goddamn world.
translation.ja: アメリカは世界一のマーケットだ

translation.en: It was a fucking crowning glory to break there.
translation.ja: そこで俺たちはブレイクできたのさ

translation.en: [Richards] I was amazed by the warmth of the welcome.
translation.ja: アメリカ人の歓迎ぶりには驚いた 特にニューヨークはね

translation.en: Especially with the first hit being New York City.
translation.ja: 特にニューヨークはね

translation.en: [Richards] I mean, the buildings, the feel and the smell of the place.
translation.ja: 建物や雰囲気や匂いに興奮したのを覚えてる

translation.en: [Richards] That night, I remember writing to my mum there, "Mum, I'm in New York City.
translation.ja: その夜 母に手紙を書いた“ニューヨークにいる⸺”

translation.en: I'll tell you more later."
translation.ja: “詳細は また今度”と

translation.en: [Richards] God knows what they were expecting. In some places, I mean...
translation.ja: 現地ではどんな目で見られてたのかな

translation.en: I do remember The Stones being arrested
translation.ja: ジョージア州で上半身裸で泳いでて

translation.en: for topless bathing in Georgia
translation.ja: 逮捕されたのは覚えてる

translation.en: at a Holiday Inn swimming pool, which was in sight of this highway.
translation.ja: ホリデイ･インのプールだ 高速道路が近くにあり

translation.en: And some freaked out locals thought, because of the hair,
translation.ja: 長髪の俺たちを見てビビったらしい

translation.en: that there was a load of chicks jumping in the pool, naked, you know...
translation.ja: 女の子が裸でプールにいると思われたんだ

translation.en: So the cop car drives up to the pool. [laughing]
translation.ja: その後 ホテルのプールに到着した警察は

translation.en: We're looking at them, the cops are looking at us, you know,
translation.ja: その後 ホテルのプールに到着した警察は 俺らにカルチャーショックを受けてたよ

translation.en: and it was like culture shock.
translation.ja: 俺らにカルチャーショックを受けてたよ

translation.en: In those days, if you went further south than Washington,
translation.ja: 当時 ワシントンＤＣより南に行くと

translation.en: it was a different kind of America then.
translation.ja: まったく様子が違ってた

translation.en: It was still strictly segregated.
translation.ja: 人種差別が根強く残ってたんだ

translation.en: You'd pull in to a joint, a whole bus of us, black and white, all mixed...
translation.ja: 黒人と白人が乗ったバスが休憩所に止まり

translation.en: Anyway, you'd pull over and dying for a pee. So I'd join in with the brothers,
translation.ja: 黒人と一緒にトイレの列に並んでたんだ

translation.en: and then they'd laugh at me and point above the door, and it said "Colored only."
translation.ja: “有色人種用”とある看板を指して笑われたよ

translation.en: I asked them, "And where am I supposed to go?" you know.
translation.ja: “俺はどこに行けば？”と尋ねたら

translation.en: And they said, "Try the bushes" or, "The white men's around the corner."
translation.ja: “茂みの中”とか“白人用”と言われた

translation.en: But there were plenty of signs of it, yeah. Chain gangs, too. Yeah.
translation.ja: そんな看板をいたる所で目にした

translation.en: To get the last taste of that bullshit was amazing to behold.
translation.ja: あのクソみたいな時代を少しだけど体験できた

translation.en: But I think that black America sort of took us a little more to their hearts
translation.ja: 黒人ファンの方が快く受け入れてくれた

translation.en: because we were different.
translation.ja: 黒人ファンの方が快く受け入れてくれた 俺たちは異質だったし

translation.en: And we had no contact with the problems that they usually had with white people.
translation.ja: 俺たちは異質だったし 当時の人種間の問題とは無関係だったからだ

translation.en: Now that's the shit.
translation.ja: 今のは最高だ

translation.en: -[Jordan] You're gonna do it? -Only if you want me to.
translation.ja: やる？ みんな次第だ

translation.en: But there's a Les Paul Jr. behind you.
translation.ja: レスポール･ジュニアは？

translation.en: [Waits] When you walk into his studio... He says his first home is the stage.
translation.ja: キースはステージが第１の故郷と言ってるから

translation.en: I think his second home would be the studio.
translation.ja: スタジオは第２の故郷だろうね

translation.en: So that's where you have to really start listening.
translation.ja: だから本気で耳を傾けるべきだ

translation.en: [Jordan] We're not... We're not using any of this.
translation.ja: これは使う予定はない

translation.en: [Waits] Everybody's tuning up and you know, that's when things start to really happen,
translation.ja: チューニングをしてる最中に魔法は起こるのさ

translation.en: uh, because no one thinks it's music yet.
translation.ja: まだ演奏だと認識してないからだ

translation.en: Yeah, it's like an orchestra tuning up, you know. It's thrilling.
translation.ja: オーケストラのチューニングと同じで

translation.en: Because it's a piece of music they will never play again, and no one called it that.
translation.ja: そこで奏でる音は二度と再現できないんだ

translation.en: Yeah, you don't wanna be looking at the frame and then realize
translation.ja: 枠にばかり気を取られてたら見落としがちになる

translation.en: that the most interesting thing going on in the frame is happening outside of the frame.
translation.ja: 最も面白いことは枠の外側で起こることをね

translation.en: [Richards] Living in England, all you knew about Chicago was Al Capone.
translation.ja: 俺にとって シカゴと言えばアル･カポネだった

translation.en: And then I found out that there's something about the stock markets...
translation.ja: 株式市場があるとその後 知った

translation.en: and I mean, meat. [chuckling] I mean, the cattle yards.
translation.ja: それから牛肉もね食肉加工が盛んだった

translation.en: The next time I really thought about Chicago
translation.ja: 最後に知ったのがブルースの存在だ

translation.en: is when I heard the blues coming out of this building we're just about to bypass.
translation.ja: 最後に知ったのがブルースの存在だ 今 通り過ぎるビルはその重要な拠点

translation.en: Chess Records, 2120 South Michigan.
translation.ja: チェス･レコードだ サウス･ミシガン通り2120番地

translation.en: We recorded there in '64.
translation.ja: 俺たちもここで1964年に収録した

translation.en: It was a magical room, sound-wise.
translation.ja: 音は最高によかったね

translation.en: How many addresses I've forgotten, that one I'll never forget, you know.
translation.ja: ここの住所だけは一生忘れないよ

translation.en: We arrived at Chess Studios.
translation.ja: チェス･レコードに行って

translation.en: Somebody's walking us through the corridor,
translation.ja: 中を案内してもらってた時だ

translation.en: and there's a black guy on a ladder painting the ceiling.
translation.ja: 廊下の天井を黒人の男性が塗ってたのさ

translation.en: As we pass by, the engineer from Chess said,
translation.ja: するとエンジニアがこう紹介したんだ

translation.en: "Oh, by the way, this is Mr. Muddy Waters."
translation.ja: するとエンジニアがこう紹介したんだ “マディ･ウォーターズです”

translation.en: So this is my first meeting.
translation.ja: 初めての対面だった

translation.en: I'm shaking hands with Muddy Waters who's got whitewash dripping.
translation.ja: ペンキを垂らしたマディと握手をすることになるとはね

translation.en: And he just said...
translation.ja: 彼はこのように言ってくれた

translation.en: "Thank you for what you guys are doing."
translation.ja: “君たちの貢献に感謝する”

translation.en: I had to digest the image later.
translation.ja: 消化するのに時間がかかった

translation.en: I mean, I'm shocked on a personal level
translation.ja: 衝撃があまりにも大きかったからだ

translation.en: to have met the very man who I've been listening to and trying to fathom out.
translation.ja: ずっと尊敬してた人と言葉を交わせたからだ

translation.en: It said a lot about black and white. [laughs]
translation.ja: しかし彼がペンキ塗りとはね

translation.en: But that's what I always said about Muddy.
translation.ja: でもそれがマディなんだ

translation.en: He was a gentleman in no matter what position you found him.
translation.ja: 彼はどんな状況でも紳士的なのさ

translation.en: Muddy Waters, Howlin' Wolf, Bo Diddley, Buddy Guy...
translation.ja: マディ･ウォーターズハウリン･ウルフ ボ･ディドリーバディ･ガイ

translation.en: All these guys were out in Chicago recording in the same studios.
translation.ja: 全員 シカゴのスタジオでレコーディングをしてた

translation.en: And everybody is like, "What do you wanna go to Chicago for?"
translation.ja: “なぜシカゴに行くんだ？”とよく聞かれたけど

translation.en: Hey, there's a reason.
translation.ja: それが理由さ

translation.en: [Buddy Guy] One, two, three.
How are you doing, Buddy?
translation.ja: バディ 一杯どう？

translation.en: -You wanna get a drink? -Yeah.
translation.ja: バディ 一杯どう？ コーン･ウイスキー 好き？

translation.en: -You drink corn liquor? -Yeah.
translation.ja: コーン･ウイスキー 好き？ もちろん

translation.en: Wait a minute. -I could have them set you up. -Yeah.
translation.ja: じゃあ 用意しないとな

translation.en: [bartender] All right, white lightning coming at ya.
translation.ja: コーン･ウイスキーね

translation.en: All right.
translation.ja: 乾杯だ

translation.en: It's got a kick, man.
translation.ja: なかなか効くね

translation.en: [Guy] Well, you go first. You go first, then I'll...
translation.ja: 君が先だ　俺は後でいく

translation.en: There we go. I gotta shoot on that one, right?
translation.ja: やるな　次は俺だよね

translation.en: [Guy] I think I can make this one, Keith.
translation.ja: 入れられると思う

translation.en: -[laughs] -Then I scratch.
translation.ja: スクラッチだ

translation.en: [Guy] Came here September the 25th, 1957.
translation.ja: 1957年９月25日にシカゴに来た

translation.en: They had a thousand blues clubs. Some of them didn't hold but 22 people.
translation.ja: ブルースクラブであふれ客席が20程度の店もあった

translation.en: Hardly wasn't no air-conditioning this time of year,
translation.ja: エアコンがなくドアを開けてるから

translation.en: and they kept the doors open
translation.ja: エアコンがなくドアを開けてるから 前を通り過ぎると演奏が聞こえてくるんだ

translation.en: so if you walked by, you would hear these harmonicas and drums.
translation.ja: 前を通り過ぎると演奏が聞こえてくるんだ

translation.en: And I found out that, if you played good,
translation.ja: 演奏がうまい奴は得だった

translation.en: you got a good drunk, and you got a good-looking woman if you sounded all right.
translation.ja: おいしい酒も美女も手に入るからね

translation.en: [Guy] Yes, sir.
translation.ja: なるほど

translation.en: [Richards] Yep.
translation.ja: お見事

translation.en: I don't know if you remember there was a television show here called Shindig.
translation.ja: 「シンディグ！」という番組を覚えてるか？

translation.en: And they was trying to get you on...
translation.ja: 呼ばれてたやつだ

translation.en: [Richards] Yeah, Howlin' Wolf was in there.
translation.ja: 呼ばれてたやつだ 出演依頼が来た時ミックが言ったんだ

translation.en: Yeah, they was trying to get you all to play it. And Mick said...
translation.ja: 出演依頼が来た時ミックが言ったんだ

translation.en: They said... I think Mick said, "Let us bring Muddy Waters."
translation.ja: “マディ･ウォーターズも一緒に”と

translation.en: And they said, "Who in the hell is Muddy Waters?" And he said, "You mean to tell me you don't know who Muddy Waters is?
translation.ja: でも相手は彼を知らずミックは怒ったんだ

translation.en: We named ourselves after one of his famed records, Rollin' Stone."
translation.ja: “彼の曲名からバンド名を取ったのに”と

translation.en: And I even cried about that, man. And sure enough,
translation.ja: あの時は感動して泣いてしまったね

translation.en: that's when they brought Howlin' Wolf and Muddy.
translation.ja: あの時は感動して泣いてしまったね ハウリン･ウルフとマディが初めてテレビに出たんだ

translation.en: And that's the first time I'd ever seen 'em on television.
translation.ja: ハウリン･ウルフとマディが初めてテレビに出たんだ

translation.en: It was thanks to these people here, man.
translation.ja: すべて彼らのおかげさ

translation.en: Tell us something about him, Brian.
translation.ja: 彼について教えて

translation.en: Well, when we first started playing together, we started playing because we wanted to play rhythm and blues.
translation.ja: Ｒ＆Ｂをやりたくてバンドを始めたんだ

translation.en: And Howlin' Wolf was one of our greatest idols.
translation.ja: 憧れのハウリン･ウルフと

translation.en: And it's a great pleasure to find he's been booked on this show tonight. -Really is a pleasure. -Thanks to Howlin'.
translation.ja: この番組で共演できて光栄に思うよ

translation.en: So I think it's about time that you shut up -and we had Howlin' Wolf on stage. -[host] Yeah! I agree.
translation.ja: しゃべりは十分だ早く呼ぼうぜ

translation.en: Okay! Let's get him on. Howlin' Wolf! Bring him up.
translation.ja: ハウリン･ウルフです

translation.en: [Richards] I knew him very well. Chester, I think, was his real name.
translation.ja: 彼の本名はチェスターだ

translation.en: Big man. The gentle giant.
translation.ja: 体は大きいが穏やかだった

translation.en: When you're that big and intimidating, you don't really have to do anything about it. You know what I mean? [chuckles]
translation.ja: あれだけ威圧感があると何もする必要がないしね

translation.en: These guys were gentlemen in the true meaning of the word.
translation.ja: 彼らは実に優しい性格だった

translation.en: I mean, I've no doubt they could be as mean as, you know... And I didn't wanna know.
translation.ja: 怒らせたらきっと恐ろしいことになるけど

translation.en: But there was an innate politeness about them.
translation.ja: 普段は礼儀正しく紳士的だった

translation.en: They were in awe that we'd even heard of them. And we were in awe of meeting them.
translation.ja: 俺たちがファンだと聞いて彼らは恐縮してたよ

translation.en: And so you have this mutual appreciation society going on,
translation.ja: だから何となく互いに敬意を払ってたのさ

translation.en: which still goes on to this day.
translation.ja: 今でも同じだ

translation.en: [Guy] Ah! There you go!
translation.ja: やるじゃないか

translation.en: I used to go into Chess and try to turn my amplifier up, out loud,
translation.ja: チェス･レコードでアンプの音量を上げたら うるさいと言って追い出されたんだ

translation.en: and they would run me out saying, "Don't nobody wanna hear that."
translation.ja: うるさいと言って追い出されたんだ

translation.en: But when they started playing and it got back to Leonard, he said,
translation.ja: でもキースたちの演奏を聞いて

translation.en: "The British are playing it, and it's getting over."
translation.ja: レナード･チェスも考えを変えてた

translation.en: So I turned my amp up like these British guys.
translation.ja: だから俺も音量を上げてやったよ

translation.en: Do you have to live that life to be a blues player?
translation.ja: ブルースはあの時代特有なのか？

translation.en: Do you have to be black or white to play the blues?
translation.ja: 黒人や白人である必要はあるか？

translation.en: Hell no, man!
translation.ja: 答えは簡単さ

translation.en: The bottom line, it's about the good and the bad times.
translation.ja: 苦労と喜びを経験すれば弾ける

translation.en: And if you haven't had a bad time in life, just keep living.
translation.ja: 苦労を知らないのなら生き続けろ

translation.en: [Richards] All right.
translation.ja: いくよ

translation.en: -[Guy laughing] I give up, man. -[Richards laughing]
translation.ja: もうギブアップだ

translation.en: All right. All right.
translation.ja: 君には完敗だよ

translation.en: Ah, that's where I left it.
translation.ja: ここに置いてたのか

translation.en: Why did I bother to play piano? A guy called Ian Stewart, you know.
translation.ja: なぜピアノを弾くかって？ イアン･スチュワートは

translation.en: He started The Stones,
translation.ja: ストーンズの結成時メンバーで⸺

translation.en: and he was one of the best boogie pianists I had heard.
translation.ja: ストーンズの結成時メンバーで⸺ ピアノでブギを弾かせたらピカイチだった

translation.en: I mean, especially in England.
translation.ja: 特にイギリスではね

translation.en: There was one thing he played. I said, "Look, I gotta learn how to do that."
translation.ja: 彼が弾いてたある曲を俺も習いたくなって

translation.en: Just show me, you know, just the basics.
translation.ja: 基礎だけでも教えてもらったんだ

translation.en: For me, in the right mood, and at the right instrument,
translation.ja: 気分が乗ってる時に楽器を持つと

translation.en: there's a certain feeling of being an antenna,
translation.ja: 自然と全身がアンテナになるんだ

translation.en: receiving and then transmitting.
translation.ja: 受信をして 送信するのさ

translation.en: I'll sit down at the piano and pick up the guitar
translation.ja: ピアノかギターでバディ･ホリーや

translation.en: and happily play Buddy Holly or Otis Redding.
translation.ja: オーティス･レディングを奏でてみるんだ

translation.en: And then, somewhere, with a bit of luck,
translation.ja: ラッキーなこともたまに起こる

translation.en: you realize that something you'd thought that you'd played wrong was actually...
translation.ja: たとえ弾き方を間違えてもそこから⸺

translation.en: a start of a whole different song.
translation.ja: 新しい曲が生まれたりするんだ

translation.en: I said, "I gotta learn this, man."
translation.ja: 教えてもらった曲さ

translation.en: I wrote a lot of stuff on piano.
translation.ja: “夜をぶっとばせ”はピアノで書いた

translation.en: I wrote "Let's Spend The Night Together," "Have You Seen Your Mother, Baby,"
translation.ja: “夜をぶっとばせ”はピアノで書いた “マザー･イン･ザ･シャドウ”も

translation.en: but I don't consider myself a piano player.
translation.ja: でも俺はピアニストじゃない

translation.en: I use it as a paint box, you know, just to...
translation.ja: 絵の具で描く感覚で弾いてる

translation.en: A touch here, a touch there. Usually just the right hand.
translation.ja: 彩りを加えるんだ右手だけでね

translation.en: Actually, I piss about a lot. And then it's... And it's like, whatever strikes me.
translation.ja: 苦戦することが多いその時の気分次第だね

translation.en: But I've always loved playing the piano. I think one of the reasons...
translation.ja: でもピアノを弾くのは昔から好きなんだ

translation.en: Being a guitar player, you know, your instrument is in a strange, you know...
translation.ja: ギターは 何て言うか持ち方が自然じゃないのさ

translation.en: a different position.
translation.ja: でもピアノの場合はチェスの駒のように

translation.en: But the piano, to me, it's, like, laid out like a chess game.
translation.ja: でもピアノの場合はチェスの駒のように 鍵盤が目の前に並んでる

translation.en: -See, I love my country shit. -[man chuckles]
translation.ja: お気に入りの歌だ

translation.en: See, country music...
translation.ja: カントリーに関して言うと…

translation.en: I was listening to Porter Wagoner in 1953, man. I mean, yeah,
translation.ja: カントリーに関して言うと… ポーター･ワゴナーは1953年から聴いてた

translation.en: Johnny Cash, Hank Williams...
translation.ja: ジョニー･キャッシュハンク･ウィリアムスも

translation.en: We didn't get a lot of it in England, but, yeah, well aware of it.
translation.ja: イギリスではあまり多く聴けなかったけど

translation.en: My mother made sure of that.
translation.ja: 母親の影響だ

translation.en: Country music, I mean, to me,
translation.ja: カントリー･ミュージックは

translation.en: I heard stories that you're never quite sure,
translation.ja: カントリー･ミュージックは 想像を絶するような大変な世界を描いてるけどね

translation.en: you know, how nasty it can get.
translation.ja: 想像を絶するような大変な世界を描いてるけどね

translation.en: Beautiful woodwork.
translation.ja: 木目が美しい

translation.en: The boards, the hallowed boards, yeah.
translation.ja: 神聖なるステージだね

translation.en: [Richards] I've only played here once, with Willie Nelson.
translation.ja: ウィリー･ネルソンとここで共演した

translation.en: It was built as a church.
translation.ja: 最初は教会だったが

translation.en: And now it's a temple to country music.
translation.ja: 今ではカントリーの神殿だ

translation.en: What's the difference, you know?
translation.ja: 目的は変わらない

translation.en: We all come here to worship and pray to the best, you know.
translation.ja: 尊き者を崇拝し祈りを捧げに来るのさ

translation.en: And God knows everybody's been on here.
translation.ja: 多くの偉人がここに立った

translation.en: I first heard country music on a pirate radio station.
translation.ja: 海賊放送で初めてカントリーを聴いたんだ

translation.en: [Richards] Reception was dodgy.
translation.ja: 電波の状態は悪かった

translation.en: That required a lot of maneuvering around the room with the antenna, you know? [laughs]
translation.ja: だからアンテナを持って部屋の中を動き回ってたよ

translation.en: But country music immediately, like, pulled chimes within me, you know.
translation.ja: カントリーは聴いた途端に心を奪われたんだ

translation.en: I mean, it was the melodies, I think, and also the guitars, you know.
translation.ja: カントリーは聴いた途端に心を奪われたんだ あのメロディーやギターのせいだと思う

translation.en: You know, that pedal steel's a heartbreaker, man.
translation.ja: ペダル･スティール･ギターの音色は泣きそうになる

translation.en: Sometimes the songs are really dopey.
translation.ja: 歌詞がダサければダサいほど

translation.en: But then sometimes the dopiest song would have the best melody.
translation.ja: 歌詞がダサければダサいほど メロディーがよかったりする

translation.en: And at the same time there was a certain edge on certain guys.
translation.ja: シンガーの貫禄がものをいうんだ

translation.en: Hank Williams, particularly.
translation.ja: ハンク･ウィリアムスとかね

translation.en: You measure country music by this cat.
translation.ja: 彼がカントリーの基準となってる

translation.en: [Richards] Hank Williams, Johnny Cash, Merle Haggard...
translation.ja: ハンクとジョニーそしてマール･ハガード

translation.en: They were pretty tough guys.
translation.ja: ３人ともワルだったよね

translation.en: The reality of country music on the road is something else.
translation.ja: カントリー･シンガーの私生活は波乱万丈だ

translation.en: Rock and roll's got nothing on those guys.
translation.ja: ロック･ミュージシャンも顔負けさ

translation.en: The Stones once turned up at a Holiday Inn in Fresno, something like that.
translation.ja: フレズノのホリデイ･インにストーンズが泊まった時

translation.en: And there's this smell of paint everywhere. They go, "There's your room."
translation.ja: 案内された部屋がペンキ臭かったんだ

translation.en: And, "What's going on?" And they said, "Well...
translation.ja: 従業員に理由を聞いたら

translation.en: [chuckling] Johnny Cash and Luther Perkins were here two nights ago
translation.ja: ２日前にジョニーとルーサー･パーキンスが

translation.en: and painted the whole damn room orange. Drapes and all," he says.
translation.ja: 部屋中をオレンジ色に塗って帰ったらしい

translation.en: If I'd have known, I would've brought some paint cleaner.
translation.ja: ペンキ落としが欲しかった

translation.en: [man] You never had any Nudie suits, did you?
translation.ja: ヌーディー･スーツは？

translation.en: [Richards] I'll tell you what, Gram Parsons used to pass his cast-offs to me, yeah.
translation.ja: グラム･パーソンズが彼のお古をくれたんだ

translation.en: I did have one of Gram's Nudie suits.
translation.ja: だから１着だけは持ってた

translation.en: It was made by a tailor in San Fernando Valley called Nudie.
translation.ja: サンフェルナンド･バレーの仕立て屋のものだ

translation.en: We used to go around there, yeah. What a madman.
translation.ja: あの辺りは変わり者が多かった

translation.en: Gram Parsons taught me so much about this mystique of the "country."
translation.ja: カントリーの文化はグラムから教わったんだ

translation.en: I was very much drawn to him, and he was the big influence.
translation.ja: だから彼の影響は大きかった

translation.en: [Richards] Gram hung with us when we were cutting Exile On Main Street and "Wild Horses."
translation.ja: グラムはアルバム制作中も俺たちとよくつるんでた

translation.en: Meeting Gram, I got fully immersed in country music.
translation.ja: おかげでカントリーにどっぷりハマったよ

translation.en: But as much as he was a country boy and loved his country music,
translation.ja: 彼は心からカントリーを愛してたが

translation.en: his idea of America was very bizarre, you know? And, uh...
translation.ja: 彼の考えるアメリカのイメージはぶっ飛んでたね

translation.en: So, I said, "That's bizarre."
translation.ja: 本人にそう伝えたら“これを見ろ”と言うんだ

translation.en: And he said, "You wanna see how bizarre? Look at this."
translation.ja: 本人にそう伝えたら“これを見ろ”と言うんだ “こいつはキャデラックに角をつけてるんだぞ”

translation.en: This guy has got longhorns on the end of his Cadillac.
translation.ja: “こいつはキャデラックに角をつけてるんだぞ”

translation.en: So, to me, all of this temple for a Stetson and some rhinestones is like...
translation.ja: だからここはカウボーイ帽とラインストーンの神殿なんだ

translation.en: But that says the other side of what country music is about. It's the razzle-dazzle.
translation.ja: カントリーにもきらびやかな世界があるのさ

translation.en: It's Colonel Parker and the dancing chickens.
translation.ja: トム･パーカーに象徴される

translation.en: Me, I didn't see the Stetson and the rhinestones. I just heard the music.
translation.ja: 俺は音楽しか聴いてなかったけどね

translation.en: And I always knew that this is the heartland.
translation.ja: ナッシュビルという心臓部で

translation.en: This is where American music was put in the crucible
translation.ja: アメリカの音楽は混ざり合ったんだ

translation.en: and came out as, you know, pretty much pure silver.
translation.ja: そして混ざり合った結果⸺ 美しい純銀になったのさ

translation.en: This was rock and roll. That's where country music and the blues sort of collided.
translation.ja: カントリーとブルースが衝突してロックが生まれた

translation.en: I always felt myself fortunate to be in a spot where, in America,
translation.ja: いくつもの音楽が交わり新しい形が生まれた⸺

translation.en: these few forms of music were somehow merging and creating something else, you know?
translation.ja: その瞬間に立ち会えて俺はラッキーだと思う

translation.en: So, it was great to watch and be a part of, and now be the king of.
translation.ja: そして今ではキングになってしまったよ

translation.en: Mind you, I don't go around searching for songs, you know, with a butterfly net.
translation.ja: 虫取り網を持って曲を探し回ったりはしない

translation.en: Because I think, basically, songs have to come to you.
translation.ja: 曲の方から近づいてくるものなんだ

translation.en: You know, going around, like, trying to winkle them out with a sharp stick,
translation.ja: やりを持って捕らえに行くわけじゃない

translation.en: going, "Come here, you little son-of-a-bitch."
translation.ja: “こっちへ来やがれ”と

translation.en: I wrote a sort of country song, roaming around the hallways of this house.
translation.ja: 家の廊下を歩きながら⸺ カントリーソングを書いてたんだ

translation.en: And it's not often, my old lady suddenly came out of the bedroom,
translation.ja: すると妻が寝室から出てきてこう言ったんだ

translation.en: and looked over and said, "That's a good song."
translation.ja: すると妻が寝室から出てきてこう言ったんだ “いい曲ね”と

translation.en: Hey, if the wife says so...
translation.ja: 妻がそう言うなら…

translation.en: It was very Hank Williams. And then I thought, "No, it's too Hank Williams.
translation.ja: でもハンク･ウィリアムスに似すぎてると気づいた

translation.en: Let's give it a kick. Let's push it up."
translation.ja: だからスピードを上げた

translation.en: And I loved working with the drummer.
translation.ja: ドラムとの相性も抜群だ

translation.en: It's a one-on-one thing.
translation.ja: １対１でやるのさ

translation.en: And it's an amazingly uncomplicated way to deal with... Especially playing rock and roll.
translation.ja: ロックの場合はさらにシンプルで楽だ

translation.en: And the other thing, too, I mean, just as a fan...
translation.ja: キースのファンとして興奮したのは

translation.en: I love the way he plays bass.
translation.ja: 彼のベース演奏だ

translation.en: [Jordan] That was very exciting for me, to have Keith play as many instruments as possible.
translation.ja: 複数の楽器を弾いてくれるとワクワクするよね

translation.en: Because those are some of my favorite Stones records,
translation.ja: ストーンズのアルバムでも

translation.en: when he played the bass and all the guitars.
translation.ja: そういう曲の方が好きだった

translation.en: [Richards] I've done some bass tracks in my time. I do love playing bass.
translation.ja: ベースは好きだしこれまでもよく弾いてきた

translation.en: I'm probably a better bass player than I am guitar, actually. [laughs]
translation.ja: ギターよりも上手かもね

translation.en: -[man] Look at you! -I love this shit. I love this shit.
translation.ja: 最高だね　楽しいよ

translation.en: Well, that goes back to Steve Jordan saying to me,

translation.en: "Hey, man," you know, in his sweet, shy, unassuming manner...
translation.ja: この柔らかい気取らない口調でさ

translation.en: He went, "How did you cut 'Jumpin' Jack Flash'?"
translation.ja: “ジャンピン･ジャック･フラッシュは⸺”

translation.en: You know?
translation.ja: “どう録ったの？”

translation.en: "How did you cut 'Street Fighting Man'?"
translation.ja: “ストリート･ファイティング･マンは？”

translation.en: In those days, you know, you'd say, roughly, what time you're, you know, "What time at the studio?"
translation.ja: 昔はスタジオに集まる時間も適当だった

translation.en: You can say 8:00 or 9:00 in the evening, you know,
translation.ja: 夜の８時や９時と言ってても

translation.en: and the band would turn up around midnight. [laughs] You know.
translation.ja: 全員が来るのは真夜中だったりする

translation.en: Sometimes I would deliberately go in early, you know, and...
translation.ja: 早めに入る時もあった

translation.en: Or if, you know, I was with Charlie, for instance, I would say, "Let's go in early and..."
translation.ja: チャーリーと事前に約束をしたりしてさ

translation.en: And, basically, I'd go in just to sort of chop a few ideas about.
translation.ja: アイデアを試してみるためだ

translation.en: But now and again, you'd actually find out this is the track.
translation.ja: でもそれが曲に発展したりする

translation.en: [Richards on recording] One, two. One, two, three, four.
"Street Fighting Man," I think, was the first one that occurred that way.
translation.ja: “ストリート”はそうして生まれた最初の曲だ

translation.en: Charlie and I were just fiddling about.
translation.ja: チャーリーと２人で⸺ 路上にいる感覚で演奏してたんだ

translation.en: And, in there, it sounds like a couple of people busking, you know.
translation.ja: 路上にいる感覚で演奏してたんだ

translation.en: Charlie's playing this tiny, little traveling drum kit, and I'm playing an acoustic, you know.
translation.ja: 持ち運びできるドラムとアコースティックギターでね

translation.en: "Yeah, well, let's just build up on it."
translation.ja: そこから作り上げていったんだ

translation.en: There's not an electric guitar on that one, no. It's all overloaded acoustics.
translation.ja: エレクトリックギターは利用しなかった

translation.en: I realized that I could use a cassette machine basically as a pick-up.
translation.ja: カセットプレーヤーを活用できると気づいたんだ

translation.en: And I play an acoustic guitar through it and, like, slam it through so loud
translation.ja: アコースティックで大音量で録ったのさ

translation.en: that it was totally overloaded.
translation.ja: 音割れするほどね

translation.en: The 1967 Norelco, the same one that you would carry around with you. Found it.
translation.ja: 当時 持ち歩いてたのと同じ1967年型を見つけた

translation.en: Again. Play.
translation.ja: 弾いてみて

translation.en: That's as much as you're gonna get. Let's see what comes out. [chuckles]
translation.ja: とりあえず ここまでだ

translation.en: Then they'd put a microphone on that and put it into the studio.
translation.ja: これをマイクでスタジオにつなぐんだ

translation.en: Basically, you have an electric guitar, but with the feel of an acoustic.
translation.ja: アコースティック調の エレクトリックギターに聞こえる

translation.en: [Richards on tape] That's as much as you're gonna get.
translation.ja: とりあえず ここまでだ

translation.en: [Richards] Basically starts there, and Mick would finish it off.
translation.ja: そうやって書き始め⸺ ミックが仕上げる

translation.en: [Richards] We were working so hard in those days that you couldn't write 'em fast enough.
translation.ja: バンドの勢いに曲作りが追いつかなかった

translation.en: I'll throw the bass on and, you know, put another guitar on,

translation.en: and we sort of finished the track in two hours.
translation.ja: ２時間程度で曲を完成させてた

translation.en: But sometimes, you never know.
translation.ja: 収録では何が起こるか分からない

translation.en: You're in a recording, you can go in there with everything sort of planned...
translation.ja: 収録では何が起こるか分からない 準備を整えてスタジオに入っても

translation.en: and it just doesn't click.
translation.ja: ダメな時もある

translation.en: [Richards] "Sympathy" was a whole different set-up.
translation.ja: “悪魔を憐れむ歌”は時間をかけて

translation.en: I think that was a good 35 takes.
translation.ja: 少なくとも35テイクは録ったと思う

translation.en: [Richards] And that song, also, through those takes, went from being a sort of
translation.ja: でもその間変化を遂げていったんだ

translation.en: Dylan-esque sort of ballad, you know, really...
translation.ja: 最初はディランっぽいバラードだった

translation.en: to just an acoustic guitar and a very, sort of... a lament, almost.
translation.ja: アコースティックギターを使った⸺ 嘆きの歌のようだった

translation.en: And we did that for a bit and went...
translation.ja: でも何度か演奏して

translation.en: "This song could take a little more juice." You know? [laughing]
translation.ja: もっと勢いが欲しいと気づいた

translation.en: And, slowly, it built up...
translation.ja: 俺はベースを弾いてチャーリーと一緒に

translation.en: Yeah, I took the bass in on that, with Charlie,
translation.ja: 俺はベースを弾いてチャーリーと一緒に サンバ風にアレンジしてみた

translation.en: and we brought it up to a sort of samba thing.
translation.ja: サンバ風にアレンジしてみた

translation.en: And then suddenly, everybody looked, and he said, "Yeah. Yeah, all right, okay."
translation.ja: すると全員が“これだ”って顔を見合わせたのさ

translation.en: You never know quite when the magic bit's gonna come in.
translation.ja: 魔法がいつ起こるかは誰にも分かりはしない

translation.en: [Waits] Every song has at least ten songs inside of it
translation.ja: 単独でも成り立つ曲が１つの曲の中に⸺

translation.en: that can be released from the song and you can make, you know...
translation.ja: 必ず10曲ほどは含まれてるんだ ２つの曲を引き合わせて子供が生まれる感じさ

translation.en: You put two songs together in a room, they'll have offspring, you know?
translation.ja: ２つの曲を引き合わせて子供が生まれる感じさ

translation.en: If you want to start writing songs, you have to start thinking like one.
translation.ja: 曲を書きたければ頭を切り替えるべきだ

translation.en: You're trying to break into the ritual of music.
translation.ja: 曲作りという“儀式”に参加するんだ

translation.en: It's kinda like Houdini in reverse, you know.
translation.ja: フーディーニと逆の発想さ

translation.en: It's not you're trying to escape. You're trying to be let in.
translation.ja: 脱出するのではなくいかに入り込むかなんだ

translation.en: [man] The story I'd heard about you meeting him... I think you were doing Rain Dogs.
translation.ja: キースと出会ったのは“レイン･ドッグ”の頃？

translation.en: Well, my wife, she said, "Who would you like?"
translation.ja: ある時 妻に“誰に電話したい？”と聞かれた

translation.en: And I told her, "Oh, Keith Richards."
translation.ja: ある時 妻に“誰に電話したい？”と聞かれた “キース･リチャーズ”と答えた

translation.en: I was, like, saying, "Lenny Bruce..."
translation.ja: “キース･リチャーズ”と答えた “レニー･ブルース”

translation.en: Uh, you know...
translation.ja: “レニー･ブルース”

translation.en: "Muddy Waters," you know.
translation.ja: “マディ･ウォーターズも”

translation.en: And she went ahead and started calling.
translation.ja: すると妻は本当に電話をしたんだ

translation.en: It was like a prank call.
translation.ja: まるで いたずら電話さ

translation.en: -And then he picked up, you know. -[man chuckles]
translation.ja: するとキース本人が出た

translation.en: [Richards] We bumped into each other 30 years ago.
translation.ja: トムとは30年前に出会ったんだ

translation.en: I loved him from the minute I met him.
translation.ja: 会った瞬間にホレたね

translation.en: When he came, he came in a semi with about 300 guitars.
translation.ja: トレーラーで来たのさ ギターを300本も持ってくるとはね

translation.en: So I wasn't ready for that, either, you know.
translation.ja: ギターを300本も持ってくるとはね

translation.en: And he had a guitar valet
translation.ja: さらにギターを運ぶ専任のスタッフがいたんだ

translation.en: who was, like, bringing guitars over like beverages and desserts, you know.
translation.ja: さらにギターを運ぶ専任のスタッフがいたんだ デザートや飲み物みたいにね

translation.en: And it was just... It was a little overwhelming for me.
translation.ja: あれにはちょっと圧倒された

translation.en: [Richards] Tom's an eccentric. The first time I met him,
translation.ja: トムは変わり者さ 彼は部屋いっぱいに奇妙な楽器を集めてたんだ

translation.en: he had a room full of instruments of the most bizarre kinds.
translation.ja: 彼は部屋いっぱいに奇妙な楽器を集めてたんだ

translation.en: He had a Mellotron, but it only played train noises. [laughing]
translation.ja: メロトロンもあったけど 電車のような音しか出せなかった

translation.en: Yeah, there's a couple of spots.
translation.ja: 枠組みを見失ってしまったけど

translation.en: I just lost the frame, but I don't think it really matters,
translation.ja: 枠組みを見失ってしまったけど あまり関係ないと思う

translation.en: 'cause you can just, you know...
translation.ja: あまり関係ないと思う

translation.en: If it gets in the way, you can just drift it off and then put it back up.
translation.ja: 邪魔なら取って必要なら また復活させる

translation.en: Yeah, yeah, yeah.
translation.ja: そうだね

translation.en: That first time, we'd been jamming for an hour or so, and then,
translation.ja: 初めて会った時１時間もジャムってたんだ

translation.en: I didn't even... You know... And there were beverages involved.
translation.ja: 知らぬ間にね 確かにお酒は飲んでたけど

translation.en: I must admit, I was trying to match him,
translation.ja: 確かにお酒は飲んでたけど 俺は彼に合わせてただけだ

translation.en: which you must never try to ever do.
translation.ja: それが大きな間違いだった

translation.en: But... And so after an hour or so, I was... I didn't know where I was.
translation.ja: 俺はどこにいるのかも分からなかった

translation.en: And then, I say, "What did we just get? What, do we have anything?"
translation.ja: “何か完成したの？曲はできた？”と聞いたら

translation.en: And then, he says... [hoarsely] "Scribe."
translation.ja: 彼は俺に向かって“書記！”と叫んだんだ

translation.en: And then I realized I was the scribe.
translation.ja: 書き上げた楽曲はすべて

translation.en: I was supposed to be keeping track of everything.
translation.ja: 俺が記録しておくべきだったらしい

translation.en: Yeah, something like that.
translation.ja: そんな感じだ

translation.en: I'm really happy to have been able to write songs with him, actually.
translation.ja: 彼と一緒に曲を作れてうれしいよ

translation.en: Because it took me a long time to realize that he never wrote songs
translation.ja: 彼は奥さんのキャサリンとしか

translation.en: except with Kathleen, his wife, you know.

translation.en: And so, to me, it was a real... I realized, a real privilege.
translation.ja: だから俺としては光栄なことさ

translation.en: [man] You got "Love Overdue." Could you talk about that track?
translation.ja: “ラヴ･オーヴァーデュー”について聞かせて

translation.en: Hats off, yeah. That was another tip of the hat to...
translation.ja: それも敬意を表して選んだ曲さ

translation.en: I've always loved that song and Gregory Isaacs.

translation.en: There's a certain urgency about it, a truth about it.

translation.en: I've always loved reggae.
translation.ja: レゲエは最高だね

translation.en: Basically, I happened to start living in Jamaica
translation.ja: 実はジャマイカに住んでたことがあるんだ
実はジャマイカに住んでたことがあるんだ 1971年から1972年頃だ

translation.en: just as reggae was catching fire, you know.
translation.ja: ちょうど ボブ･マーリーの

translation.en: In fact, Catch a Fire had just come out, Bob Marley, and...
translation.ja: “キャッチ･ア･ファイアー”が出た頃だった ジミー･クリフの“ザ･ハーダー･ゼイ･カム”も

translation.en: Jimmy Cliff, The Harder They Come. There was a whole explosion that year.
translation.ja: ジミー･クリフの“ザ･ハーダー･ゼイ･カム”も 大ブレイクした時に住んでたんだ

translation.en: And I'm living there.

translation.en: [Richards] It felt like the early days of rock and roll.
translation.ja: ロックが誕生した頃に似てた

translation.en: I felt the same sort of energy and joy
translation.ja: 同じエネルギーと喜びが感じられたんだ

translation.en: and sense of discovery amongst people,
translation.ja: 彼らはやっと見つけたのさ

translation.en: that they'd found their voice.
translation.ja: 自らの声を伝える手段をね

translation.en: [Richards] Jamaica provided an amazing burst of talent and energy.
translation.ja: ジャマイカはパワーにあふれ逸材の宝庫だった

translation.en: It was very refreshing to me. Yeah, yeah.
translation.ja: とても新鮮に感じたよ

translation.en: And, so, you're sort of back in the beginning of something again.
translation.ja: 久しぶりにスタート地点に立った気分だった

translation.en: What I really love about reggae, it's all so...
translation.ja: レゲエの自然な感じが好きなんだ

translation.en: natural, you know. There's none of this forced stuff.

translation.en: And at that time, I was getting really sick of rock music.
translation.ja: その頃 ロックに嫌気がさしてたんだ

translation.en: Rock and roll, I never get sick of.
translation.ja: “ロックンロール”には決して飽きることはない

translation.en: But there was less and less of that and more rock music,
translation.ja: “ロックンロール”には決して飽きることはない でも“ロック”は白人が独自に生み出したものだ

translation.en: which is actually a white man's version. It turns out to be like...
translation.ja: でも“ロック”は白人が独自に生み出したものだ

translation.en: They'll turn it into a march, basically, you know...
translation.ja: マーチっぽい音楽なんだ

translation.en: Yeah, I mean, eventually, that's what... That's their version of rock.
translation.ja: これを奴らは“ロック”と呼んでた

translation.en: You know, it's like, "Excuse me, I prefer the roll."
translation.ja: “俺はロールでいいや”と思ったね

translation.en: And that's when the cats, the Jamaican guys, came in with the horns.
translation.ja: ホーン･セクションはジャマイカから呼んだ

translation.en: Luckily, Steve's very well connected. [DeCurtis] Yes.
translation.ja: スティーヴの広い人脈のおかげさ

translation.en: So, I was like, "What we need here is a sort of Jamaican horn section."
translation.ja: “ジャマイカ人のホーン”という要望に応えてくれた

translation.en: Man, we need some more smoke. Get some weed going in this, man.
translation.ja: もっと煙がないと マリファナに火をつけろ

translation.en: -Come on, man. -[Richards] I can do that.
translation.ja: 俺に任せて

translation.en: [Jordan] You got a red, black and green scarf or something?
translation.ja: 赤と黒と緑のスカーフは？

translation.en: Can we get Keith's headband?
translation.ja: 誰か用意して

translation.en: No, you're not going to dress me, man. Okay, okay. I will.

translation.en: [man] So, how did you start recording solo in the first place?
translation.ja: ソロアルバムを出した理由は？

translation.en: I was very reluctant to start going solo.
translation.ja: ソロで活動することはためらってたんだ

translation.en: I mean, my thing has always been The Stones and you know...
translation.ja: ずっとストーンズでやってきたし⸺ 責任が一気に重くなるしね

translation.en: You'd leave at your peril.
translation.ja: 責任が一気に重くなるしね

translation.en: But things had... Circumstances had worked out in the late '80s, that, you know...
translation.ja: でもいろいろと状況が変わり1980年代後半には

translation.en: obviously, we were not going to... Mick and I were not going to be working together for a while.
translation.ja: しばらくミックと活動しないことになった

translation.en: I called 1985 to '89, that was actually World War III.
translation.ja: 俺は1985年から1989年を第３次世界大戦と呼んでる

translation.en: In a 50-year relationship doing this stuff,
translation.ja: 50年間も一緒にやっていれば

translation.en: of course, guys have fights, brothers have fights.

translation.en: You know, we're brothers.

translation.en: There was no sign of The Stones, like, poking their nose above the horizon.

translation.en: And I was at, really, a loose end.

translation.en: I mean, obviously, I gotta get into this.

translation.en: Life wouldn't be complete. I mean, the circle would be unbroken.
translation.ja: 不完全燃焼のまま人生が終わってしまうと

translation.en: [Berry] That slur is started right here.
translation.ja: 外れてる　ここだ

translation.en: Starts on the upper one.
translation.ja: 上の音から

translation.en: Listen.
translation.ja: 聞いて

translation.en: All right.

translation.en: Chuck... Chuck has his own way of showing appreciation.

translation.en: Well, don't touch my amp. Then it won't be done.

translation.en: He already said he didn't.
translation.ja: 彼は触ってない

translation.en: -Well, he says why it's being done. -[man] All right.
translation.ja: なぜかと聞くからだ

translation.en: Why it's being done is because it's not recording well.
translation.ja: 録った音がよくないからさ

translation.en: And that's what's gonna end up on the film.
translation.ja: それが残るぞ

translation.en: If it winds up on the film, that's the way Chuck Berry plays it.
translation.ja: 俺の弾き方だから仕方ない

translation.en: You understand?

translation.en: -I understand, man. I understand. -Well, I was talking to Andy about it.

translation.en: But you've got to live with it afterwards. They're trying to--

translation.en: I've been living for 60 years with it!
translation.ja: 60年間 この弾き方だ

translation.en: -I know that. I know that. -Okay, well, then realize it!

translation.en: But this is going to be here after we're all dead and gone.

translation.en: I was in his dressing room...

translation.en: and the guitar case was open, guitar was lying there.
translation.ja: 目の前のギターケースが開いてたんだ

translation.en: So, I was waiting for him. They said, you know, "He's coming in a minute."
translation.ja: チャックが来るまで時間がかかると言われたから

translation.en: So, I was just leaning over and I was just touching the strings.
translation.ja: チャックが来るまで時間がかかると言われたから 弦を少し触ってたのさ

translation.en: He came in and slammed me. [laughs]

translation.en: That was Chuck... One of Chuck's greatest hits.

translation.en: [Richards] No problems could really interfere with the fact that this was just fun.

translation.ja: その現場でスティーヴと出会った

translation.en: Steve and I were just like, "We're in rock and roll heaven."

translation.en: Goodnight, ladies and gentlemen.

translation.en: Tonight's star.

translation.en: Hand for the band!

translation.en: [Richards] And Steve and I find it quite natural to write songs.

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, Keith Richards.

translation.en: [Waddy Wachtel] When Keith and I first started to play together,

translation.en: I knew we were simpatico just by hearing what he had done all the years
translation.ja: キースとは最初から気が合うと分かってた キースとは最初から気が合うと分かってた ワディ･ワクテル ワディ･ワクテル 彼の過去の演奏を聞いてね ワディ･ワクテル

translation.en: and hearing the hands touching those strings.
translation.ja: 彼の過去の演奏を聞いてね ワディ･ワクテル 彼の過去の演奏を聞いてね

translation.en: But, yeah, we bonded pretty extremely, right away.
translation.ja: 予想してた通りあっという間に意気投合した

translation.en: [Richards] In a way, I thought, "Okay, obviously, I'm supposed to do this,"
translation.ja: これは運命だって感じたよ 流れがあまりにも自然だったからだ

translation.en: because it was organic.
translation.ja: 流れがあまりにも自然だったからだ

translation.en: You'd think one great band in a lifetime is already a miracle.

translation.en: To put two together, I mean, it's weird, in a way.

translation.en: I also understood more of Mick's job...

translation.en: by being the frontman.

translation.en: [Richards] To be right on top of everything, from the first note till the end,

translation.en: gave me a bit of discipline, actually, I probably sorely needed.

translation.en: But working outside of The Stones,

translation.en: I realized that The Stones, that's my home.

translation.en: We set them up and gave 'em to people, and now we belong to the people.

translation.en: And I can't let them down.

translation.ja: およそ10年ぶりのツアーがスタート

translation.en: [reporter 2] This will be their 13th major US tour since 1964.
translation.ja: 1964年以降全米ツアーは13回目

translation.en: [reporter 3] The Rolling Stones launched their Bigger Bang world tour last night,

translation.en: with dates in Canada, the US, South America, Europe, and Asia.

translation.en: And we'd come to a natural gasper, you know, like...
translation.ja: 当然だけど息切れしてしまったんだ

translation.en: And it occurred to me, maybe this is the time to do a book.

translation.en: I didn't really take it that seriously to start with.

translation.en: But as it went on, I understood that...

translation.en: I know who I am and people who know me know basically who I am.

translation.en: But I realize that 999 of them out there still think Keith Richards is
translation.ja: 99％の人にはきっと誤解されてるとね いつもマリファナを吸って

translation.en: smoking a joint, bottle of Jack Daniel's in his hand, like, walking down the road,

translation.en: you know, cursing the fact that the liquor store is closed.
translation.ja: 酒屋が閉まってれば悪態をつくような奴さ

translation.en: An image, man. Image like a ball and chain.

translation.en: It's not like a shadow, because it's there 24/24.

translation.en: When the sun goes down, it don't disappear.

translation.en: [Waits] A lot of this has to do with persona.

translation.en: You have to have some type of armor
translation.ja: よろいで自分を守らないと

translation.en: so that you can continue to also develop as a human being, you know.

translation.en: It's like you have a recipe, and you have a beverage,

translation.en: and you have a... a sandwich named after you, pretty much.
translation.ja: 自分の名前がついたレシピや飲み物が登場し サンドイッチまで出回る場合もある

translation.en: It's like, what it comes down to, right?
translation.ja: サンドイッチまで出回る場合もある

translation.en: But you're still able within, inside that... you're able to still grow and change.

translation.en: It's kind of a ventriloquist act a lot of the time, you know.
translation.ja: 腹話術に似てるかもしれない 腹話術に似てるかもしれない 〝アメリカから麻薬をなくそう！ 〞 〝アメリカから麻薬をなくそう！ 〞

translation.en: But it's much safer than putting your own ass out there,
translation.ja: 自分のケツをさらけ出すよりも安全だ 〝アメリカから麻薬をなくそう！ 〞 自分のケツをさらけ出すよりも安全だ

translation.en: like Judy Garland, you know, and melting every night.
translation.ja: ジュディ･ガーランドのように苦しむはめになる

translation.en: [Richards] You can't buy a persona.

translation.en: You can either make it up, or you can be it.

translation.en: My idea of actual heaven is to be a rock and roll star that nobody ever sees.

translation.en: [laughing] Totally anonymous.
translation.ja: 正体不明なのさ

translation.en: You know, you gotta go out and do this thing sometimes.
translation.ja: でも表に出ることはやっぱり避けられない

translation.en: And so after the book came out, the next thing I knew, Steve came to me and said...

translation.en: "Let's get away from the chicks." [imitates playing guitar]
translation.ja: “女どもから離れて⸺”

translation.en: And then he's like, "Say we're working, you know what I mean?"
translation.ja: “仕事をしてるフリをしよう”

translation.en: There's fates of rock and roll, you know.
translation.ja: ロックンロールを生むには

translation.en: And to do that, you eyeball each other and say...
translation.ja: お互いの目を見てこう言えばいい

translation.en: "One, two... let's go!"
This is what rock and roll is about. You feel like you're levitating.
translation.ja: 調子がいい時は浮揚してる感覚に陥る

translation.en: And when all of the guys around you are playing, and you're saying,
translation.ja: そういう時は他のメンバーも同じなのさ

translation.en: "They're feeling it too. I know it, I know it."
translation.ja: “お前らも感じてるだろ分かってるぞ”と

translation.en: And you go for those moments where you actually, you know, fly.
translation.ja: 全員で飛び立てる瞬間を目指してるんだ

translation.en: And you just hang on to it as long as you can, because it is one of the best feelings in the world.
translation.ja: その最高の感覚は簡単に手放したらダメだ

translation.en: It may be only rock and roll, but...
translation.ja: たかがロックンロールだけど

translation.en: I'm telling you what...
translation.ja: 興奮するだろ

translation.en: that's the shit.
translation.ja: そういうことさ

translation.en: ♪ At the age of five ♪
translation.ja: チェッカーボード･ラウンジ　１９８１年

translation.en: Of all of the people I have ever met, Muddy Waters, he was a father to me.
translation.ja: マディ･ウォーターズは 俺にとって親父のような存在だ

translation.en: [Richards] He took me under his wing.
translation.ja: 俺をかわいがってくれた

translation.en: It was just amazing to finally play together.
translation.ja: そしてやっと共演できたんだ

translation.en: Was I honored by that? Man, I had died and gone to heaven.
translation.ja: あれは天にも昇る心地だったよ

translation.en: For the first time ever... A Stones' show, "What are you gonna wear?" "We don't give a shit," you know what I mean?
translation.ja: ストーンズのライブでは衣装なんて気にしないんだ

translation.en: For the Checkerboard show, Ronnie and I were like, "What are we gonna wear, man?"
translation.ja: でもこの時ばかりはロニーと⸺ “どうする？”と騒いでた

translation.en: "White shirts, black vests." You know? [laughs]
translation.ja: 白シャツとベストにした

translation.en: We actually talked about what we were gonna wear before we go on.
translation.ja: 本番前に衣装のことを話し合うなんて

translation.en: This is the only time, ever, I can remember doing that.
translation.ja: あれが最初で最後だったね

translation.en: [Richards] Muddy's house.
translation.ja: マディの家だ

translation.en: Wow. You would've thought Chicago could do something more for the man, you know?

translation.en: It was a lot more vibrant the last time I was here.
translation.ja: 前回 来た時は活気にあふれてたぞ

translation.en: It was a party. I mean, it was night time. I think Willie Dixon brought me over.
translation.ja: ウィリー･ディクソンが連れてきてくれたんだ

translation.en: It was rocking when I got here, I remember that.
translation.ja: パーティーで盛り上がってた

translation.en: It's leaving I don't remember.
translation.ja: パーティーで盛り上がってた でも帰った記憶がない

translation.en: I crashed out here. But I woke up in Howlin' Wolf's house.
translation.ja: 酔いつぶれてハウリンの家で目覚めたんだ

translation.en: I don't know what happened. I got carried away.
translation.ja: 誰かが運んでくれたんだろうね

translation.en: The party continued, and I went with it.

translation.en: [Waters] Get Mickey a towel, will ya?

translation.en: Thank you very much, ladies and gentlemen.
translation.ja: ありがとうございます

translation.en: We'll keep the show moving. Mr. Muddy Waters! Give it to him! Give it to Mr. Muddy Waters.
translation.ja: マディ･ウォーターズに再び大きな拍手を

translation.en: [man] You know, Muddy was younger then than you are now.
translation.ja: 当時のマディの年齢を超えました

translation.en: I mean, it seems like you, when you were young,
translation.ja: 当時のマディの年齢を超えました 若い頃 あなたは彼らに憧れを抱いてて

translation.en: kind of wanted to be one of those guys.
translation.ja: 若い頃 あなたは彼らに憧れを抱いてて

translation.en: And now, in a way, you kind of are one of those guys.
translation.ja: 今は同じような立場になりました

translation.en: Yeah, I know.
translation.ja: そうだね

translation.en: Life's a funny thing, you know.
translation.ja: 人生は不思議だ

translation.en: And nobody wants to get old, but they don't wanna die young either.
translation.ja: 年を取るのはイヤだが早死にもしたくない

translation.en: You know, and you just gotta follow this thing down the path, you know.
translation.ja: 分かるだろ？ 導かれるがままに進むしかない

translation.en: After I left home, my dad and my mother split up.
translation.ja: 俺が実家を出た後両親が離婚したんだ

translation.en: And then I lost touch with my dad for 20 years.
translation.ja: その後 父には20年間連絡しなかった

translation.en: Maybe, 'cause I was thinking about, "God, what he must've thought of me?"
translation.ja: どう思われてるか不安だったんだ

translation.en: I mean, he was a straight-up guy. I mean, a hardworking man and all that.
translation.ja: 父は仕事一筋の真面目な男だったからね

translation.en: You know, I mean, the idea of his son being busted for drugs.
translation.ja: 息子が麻薬をやって捕まるなんてさ

translation.en: I could think of him saying...
translation.ja: こう言ってそうだ

translation.en: "Well, he'd never come to any good."
translation.ja: “やはりろくでもない奴だ”

translation.en: After about 20 years, I wrote him a note and got one back.
translation.ja: 20年後 手紙を書いたら返事をくれて

translation.en: And we set up a meeting at my house in England.
translation.ja: 俺のイギリスの家で会うことになった

translation.en: I took Ronnie Wood with me for protection. That's how scared I was.
translation.ja: 緊張のあまりロニーにも来てもらった

translation.en: The door opens and out comes out this little old guy.
translation.ja: ドアを開けたら小柄な男性が立ってた

translation.en: You know, his legs have gone a bit and he's like...
translation.ja: 足腰が少し弱ってたけど

translation.en: But it was Dad, you know, and it was...
translation.ja: 紛れもなく俺の親父だった

translation.en: It was so easy. Within a few minutes, we sorted it all well out.
translation.ja: 数分も経たないうちに自然と打ち解けてた

translation.en: And he became, for the next 20 years, my best mate.
translation.ja: その時以来親父は俺の大親友さ

translation.en: For another 20 years, he came on every trip, every show, come around the world with me.
translation.ja: 20年間 ツアーや旅行で世界各地を一緒に回ったんだ

translation.en: And I loved to show him the world. And he didn't mind seeing it either.
translation.ja: 俺が案内する世界を父も楽しんでたようだ

translation.en: Poor old boy. He's older than I am.
translation.ja: 俺より じいさんだよ

translation.en: Right, babe?
translation.ja: だよな

translation.en: My family, they're incredibly important, you know.
translation.ja: 俺にとって家族は何よりも大切だ

translation.en: When you see offspring of offspring, then something else hits home.
translation.ja: 自分の子供に子供が生まれると感慨深いね

translation.en: I mean, it's one thing having a kid. But when you get the grandsons and the granddaughters,
translation.ja: 子供だけでもうれしいのに孫までできるなんて⸺

translation.en: well, that is... that's an amazing feeling.
translation.ja: 形容しがたいほど幸せな気分だ

translation.en: I don't know of what. Accomplishment? I don't know. Or continuity?
translation.ja: 継承できる喜びなのか達成感なのか分からないけど

translation.en: But basically, love.
translation.ja: つまりは“愛”さ

translation.en: [Richards] I've been blessed, man.
translation.ja: 俺は恵まれてるよ

translation.en: I'll play as long as I can get away with it.
translation.ja: 体が許す限り音楽は続けるつもりだ

translation.en: And that's all I can do.
translation.ja: それしかないしね

translation.en: I'm not getting old. I'm evolving.
translation.ja: 老いじゃない　進化だ

translation.en: [man 1] Right on.
translation.ja: バッチリだったね

translation.en: -Right on. -[man 2] That was a fine piece of work.
translation.ja: バッチリだったね すばらしい出来だ

translation.en: [Richards] Once again, Larry, great to see you, man.
translation.ja: ラリー会えてうれしかったよ

translation.en: [man 3] All right. [man 4] Oh, yeah. I like this stuff.
translation.ja: いいね 気に入った

translation.en: [man 5] Yeah, balls to the walls, gentlemen.
translation.ja: 力を出し切ったね
